content.description: This is the left route on the lowest buttress.  It climbs just like it's sister, Trail Legs.  Thin edges, crystals and the odd patina edge to boot.  Nothing hard, just consistent.  Again, watch the route location near the top, as I wandered into a really rice-y section and took a fall.  If you stay on route the rock seems good.  Enjoy the view from the top.
content.protection: 7 draws are needed for this climb with 2 more for the anchors.  The anchors yet again require slings to rap off of, and if the slings are bad one will need to replace them.

content.description: This buttress is on the lower tier and is in the middle of 2 others buttresses.This buttress has 2 routes on it and this is the right route.  Trail Legs climbs just off the arete using thin smears and the occasional sidepull to gain the 1st bolt.  Bolt 2 is a little high, but from there the protection is good.  Thin edges and pea-sized crystals with the odd patina edge thrown into the mix create a fun consistent climb.  Watch the rice-y surface.  It wasn't too bad, but there were sections.
content.protection: 6 draws for protection on this route, and there are 2 bolts at the top for anchors.  They don't have chains and are not rap anchors.  Bring bail slings.
